content: Akanksha Tyagi is a Master’s student in Computer Science at the University of Arkansas and a Research Assistant under Dr. Qinghua Li. Her work centers on ML for cybersecurity, including software vulnerability testing and infrastructure security. Previously, at IIIT Hyderabad, she focused on reinforcement learning for intelligent transportation systems. She also brings experience as a software engineer and web developer, and holds a Bachelor’s degree from the College of Engineering Roorkee.
summary: Akanksha Tyagi is a Master’s student in Computer Science at the University of Arkansas and a Research Assistant under Dr. Qinghua Li. Her work centers on ML for cybersecurity, including software vulnerability testing and infrastructure security. Previously, at IIIT Hyderabad, she focused on reinforcement learning for intelligent transportation systems. She also brings experience as a software engineer and web developer, and holds a Bachelor’s degree from the College of Engineering Roorkee.
title: Akanksha Tyagi

content: Feras A. Batarseh leads research at the intersection of AI assurance and applied cyberbiosecurity, focusing on resilient water and agricultural systems and data-driven policy design. He directs the A3 Lab at Virginia Tech and collaborates across disciplines to translate AI methods into trustworthy, high-impact solutions.
summary: Feras A. Batarseh leads research at the intersection of AI assurance and applied cyberbiosecurity, focusing on resilient water and agricultural systems and data-driven policy design. He directs the A3 Lab at Virginia Tech and collaborates across disciplines to translate AI methods into trustworthy, high-impact solutions.
title: Feras A. Batarseh

content: I am a Research Assistant Professor at Old Dominion University’s Commonwealth Cyber Initiative Coastal Virginia, where I explore emerging directions in cybersecurity. Previously, I was a Presidential Postdoctoral Fellow at Virginia Tech. My work spans AI assurance, machine learning for cyberattack detection, and securing cyber-physical systems, with deployments in critical infrastructure including water distribution and agricultural networks.
summary: I am a Research Assistant Professor at Old Dominion University’s Commonwealth Cyber Initiative Coastal Virginia, where I explore emerging directions in cybersecurity. Previously, I was a Presidential Postdoctoral Fellow at Virginia Tech. My work spans AI assurance, machine learning for cyberattack detection, and securing cyber-physical systems, with deployments in critical infrastructure including water distribution and agricultural networks.
title: Nazmul Kabir Sikder

content: Rutba Aman is a lecturer in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Primeasia University in Dhaka, Bangladesh. She teaches undergraduate courses and conducts research spanning social network privacy and de-anonymization, machine learning, natural language processing, data mining, and health informatics.
summary: Rutba Aman is a lecturer in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Primeasia University in Dhaka, Bangladesh. She teaches undergraduate courses and conducts research spanning social network privacy and de-anonymization, machine learning, natural language processing, data mining, and health informatics.
title: Rutba Aman

content: Umme Rumman has worked across government and private sectors, combining technical troubleshooting, QA testing, and digital marketing. She supported device, network, and software issues for the Tottho Apa program and drove SEO and campaign reporting at Radisson Digital Technologies. She is expanding into automation testing and Go while continuing to apply analytics and reporting to improve service reliability.
summary: Umme Rumman has worked across government and private sectors, combining technical troubleshooting, QA testing, and digital marketing. title: Umme Rumman

content:
吳恩達 is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.

content: Old Dominion University becomes first university to earn NSA Cybersecurity Validation 🏆
summary: ODU becomes the first university to earn NSA cybersecurity validation.
title: Old Dominion University earns NSA cybersecurity validation

summary: Novel hybrid deep-learning architecture for accurate short-term forecasting in wastewater treatment operations.
title: Context-driven Deep Learning Forecasting for Wastewater Treatment Plants

content: Joining as a Presidential Postdoctoral Fellow at Virginia Tech, affiliated with CCI and BSE/ECE. ✨
summary: Accepted a Presidential Postdoctoral Fellow role at Virginia Tech (CCI, BSE/ECE).
title: Joining as a Presidential Postdoctoral Fellow at Virginia Tech

content: Classifies high-fidelity adversarial plant images; attributes source models (StyleGAN2/3, DS8, BLIP, Pix2Pix) alongside health status. Trains EfficientNet-B0 / ResNet-50 / CLIP-ViT on binary health, source (Real/GAN/Diffusion), and detailed 10-way crop–health–generator tasks. Designed to scale as new generators emerge; targets cyber-biosecurity for Agriculture 4.0 systems. Authors: Md Nazmul Kabir Sikder, Mehmet Oguz Yardimci, Trey Ward, Shubham Laxmikant Deshmukh, Feras A. Batarseh (Preprint, 2025).
summary: Detect and attribute GAN/diffusion-generated plant images for Agriculture 4.0 cyber-biosecurity.
title: Adversarial Image Detection in Agriculture

summary: PhD dissertation on AI-driven anomaly detection methods for critical infrastructure protection in water distribution and agricultural systems.
title: AI Methods for Anomaly Detection in Cyber-Physical Systems: With Application to Water and Agriculture

content: Successfully defended Ph.D. dissertation from Virginia Tech ✨ 🎓 🎉 📚 🔬 🏆
summary: Ph.D. dissertation defense completed at Virginia Tech.
title: Successfully defended Ph.D. dissertation at Virginia Tech

content: Attended AAAI Fall-24 Symposium ✨
summary: Participation in the AAAI Fall 2024 Symposium.
title: Attended AAAI Fall 2024 Symposium

content: 11 recent cyber attacks on the water and wastewater sector 💻 🔒 🔥 🛡️ 💥 💀 ❗ ⚔️ 😱 ☣️
summary: Roundup of recent cyber attacks targeting water and wastewater systems.
title: 11 recent cyber attacks on the water and wastewater sector

content: Two-stage pipeline: temporal context extraction plus multi-horizon forecasting. Achieves >95% accuracy with real-time updates for overflow prevention. Designed for smart water/WWTP operations.
summary: Context-aware dilated LSTM with attention for 4–6 hour wastewater tunnel level forecasts.
title: cP2O: Context-Aware Water Level Forecasting

content: New partnership uses AI to bolster efficiency, cybersecurity for water treatment ✨ 👨‍🏫 💧
summary: AI-powered efficiency and cybersecurity collaboration for water treatment.
title: New partnership uses AI to bolster efficiency and cybersecurity for water treatment

summary: AI framework for prediction, protection, and optimization of wastewater treatment plant operations.
title: P2O: AI-Driven Framework for Managing and Securing Wastewater Treatment Plants

content: Shapley-value weight assessment, reverse learning, and secret inversion to quantify XAI/FAI/SAI. Generates per-sample assurance scores and adversarial logging for production monitoring. Published with ALSP framework and validation on real-world models.
summary: Game-theoretic, model-agnostic assurance pipeline combining explainability, fairness, and security scores for AI systems.
title: Model-Agnostic Assurance (ALSP)

content: Unsupervised outlier detection tailored to crop production signals. Integrates financial indices (oil, gold, DJIA, S&P500, VIX) for risk-aware decisions. Targets real-time alerts to reduce losses and optimize farm operations.
summary: Deep learning and Isolation Forest pipeline to flag economic and operational anomalies in agriculture.
title: DeepAg: Precision Farming Anomaly Detection

summary: Comprehensive evaluation of GAN models for generating realistic synthetic datasets to overcome data scarcity in water distribution systems.
title: Assessing the Impact of Cyber Attacks on Water Distribution Systems: A Deep Learning Approach

summary: Deep learning models for detecting concealed cyber attacks in water distribution systems using TGCN and HCAE approaches.
title: Deep H2O: Cyber attacks detection in water distribution systems using deep learning

summary: Comprehensive survey of AI techniques for outlier detection across multiple domains and applications.
title: Outlier detection using AI: a survey

content: 2022 Intelligent Water Systems Challenge — Winning Solution by Virginia Tech and DC Water: Realtime Management of Wastewater Treatment Plants Using AI 🏆
summary: Realtime management of wastewater treatment plants using AI—VT and DC Water.
title: 2022 Intelligent Water Systems Challenge winning solution

summary: Two model-agnostic AIA pipelines for scoring explainability, safety, and security across domains.
title: Model-Agnostic Scoring Methods for Artificial Intelligence Assurance

content: A3 Lab and Commonwealth Cyber Initiative (CCI) partner with DC Water for Tunnel Water Level Forecasting ✨
summary: Video on the DC Water tunnel water level forecasting partnership.
title: A3 Lab and Commonwealth Cyber Initiative (CCI) partner with DC Water for Tunnel Water Level Forecasting

content: Prediction: LSTM-based tunnel water level forecasting with robust preprocessing. Protection: Cyber-physical attack detection and classification on SMOD-style datasets. Optimization: Genetic algorithm pump scheduling to cut energy use and prevent overflows.
summary: Competition-winning AI stack combining prediction, protection, and optimization for wastewater systems.
title: IWS Challenge 2022: Integrated AI for Water Systems

content: Presented MAA paper in 2022 SDSS Conference ✨ 👨‍🏫
summary: MAA paper presentation at the 2022 SDSS Conference.
title: Presented MAA paper at 2022 SDSS Conference

summary: Co-authored book on AI assurance frameworks covering trustworthiness, explainability, safety, and ethical considerations.
title: AI Assurance: Towards Trustworthy, Explainable, Safe, and Ethical AI

summary: Real-time AI-driven decision support system (RADS) for cybersecurity, prediction, and optimization in wastewater treatment.
title: Realtime management of wastewater treatment plants using AI

summary: AI2Farm model providing predictions and guidance for agricultural decision-making during conventional and unconventional times.
title: The application of artificial intelligence assurance in precision farming and agricultural economics

summary: Deep learning framework using LSTM networks to predict commodity production considering outlier events' impact on the global economy.
title: DeepAg: Deep Learning Approach for Measuring the Effects of Outlier Events on Agricultural Production and Policy

summary: Investigation of peak demand reduction potential in commercial buildings through HVAC and lighting adjustments in microgrid environments.
title: Quantification of Peak Demand Reduction Potential in Commercial Buildings due to HVAC Set Point and Brightness Adjustment

summary: Comprehensive applications of machine learning techniques in precision agriculture and smart farming systems.
title: Applications of machine learning for precision agriculture and smart farming

summary: Design and implementation of an economical and compact MPPT system using SEPIC converter with Incremental Conductance method.
title: Implementation of microcontroller based Maximum Power Point Tracker (MPPT) using SEPIC converter
